intro: Byrsonima laurifolia var. guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan soursop, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces large, fragrant, white flowers that are typically followed by yellow, spiny fruits resembling a large, round melon. The fruit contains a single large, inedible seed and is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its ornamental value and medicinal properties make it a notable species in its native habitat.
